alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued December 25 at 11:56AM EST until December 25 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph resulting in blowing snow. * WHERE...Northern Erie county. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest lake effect snow has lifted north over Lake Erie, but light snow will continue through this afternoon. Wind chills have increased above Wind Chill Advisory limits. However, sub-zero wind chills will continue through Monday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
